title: A Randomized Open-Label, Active-Controlled  Study of OPS-108 (bisphosphonate) in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes
officialTitle: A Randomized Open-Label, Active-Controlled  Study of OPS-108 (bisphosphonate) in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes
description: This is a randomized open-label, active-controlled  study designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of OPS-108 (bisphosphonate) in patients with Type 2 Diabetes. The study will enroll approximately 201 patients.
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 18-65 years
- Confirmed diagnosis of Type 2 Diabetes
- ECOG performance status 0-1
- Adequate organ function
- Willing and able to provide informed consent
- HbA1c between 7.0% and 10.0%
- Body mass index (BMI) between 25 and 40 kg/m²
- On stable antidiabetic medication for ≥3 months

Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity to study drug or excipients
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- Participation in another interventional study within 30 days
- Significant cardiovascular disease within past 6 months
- Active or chronic infection requiring systemic treatment
- History of severe hypoglycemia within past 6 months
- Estimated GFR <45 mL/min/1.73m²
- History of diabetic ketoacidosis
